page.title: 16Jobs-St.Helens Rd.-Park St.
page.content: St.Helens Road and Park Street in Abergavenny are mainly terraced stone houses built between 1870 and 1900. They were mainly built for railwaymen who worked for the L.N.W.R.100 St. Helens Rd.lived in by Helen Griffiths was owned by an engine driver.45 St. Helens Rd.lived in by Paula Sheppard used to be owned by an engine driver as well.In 1932 1/4 of the people worked for the railway.In 1985 only 4 people work in Abergavenny for British Rail and nobody in St.Helens Road works on the railway. Dads of children in Harold Road Junior School who live in the area today,do many different jobs.They work as a taxi driver,factory worker,bricklayer, coachbuilder,personnel officer and two others work for British Telecom and the Welsh Water Authority.
